title: ICE: Hir should have been pre-marked as red or green but wasn't

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-hir
labels.description: Area: the High level Intermediate Representation (HIR)

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
# Code code: https://github.com/maps4print/azul branch `rust-ice` ```sh git clone https://github.com/maps4print/azul git checkout rust-ice RUST_BACKTRACE=full cargo check --verbose --example public ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.43.1 (8d69840ab 2020-05-04) binary: rustc commit-hash: 8d69840ab92ea7f4d323420088dd8c9775f180cd commit-date: 2020-05-04 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.43.1 LLVM version: 9.0 ``` ### Error output ``` Checking azul-core v0.0.2 (/home/felix/Development/azul/azul-core) Fresh serde_bytes v0.11.3 Fresh bincode v1.2.1 Fresh font-loader v0.8.0 Running `rustc --crate-name azul_core --edition=2018 azul-core/src/lib.rs --error-format=json --json=diagnostic-rendered-ansi --crate-type rlib --crate-type cdylib --emit=dep-info,metadata -C debuginfo=2 --cfg 'feature="azul-css-parser"' --cfg 'feature="css_parser"' --cfg 'feature="default"' --cfg 'feature="gleam"' --cfg 'feature="opengl"' -C metadata=54992c066eb0e957 -C extra-filename=-54992c066eb0e957 --out-dir /home/felix/Development/azul/target/debug/deps -C incremental=/home/felix/Development/azul/target/debug/incremental -L dependency=/home/felix/Development/azul/target/debug/deps --extern azul_css=/home/felix/Development/azul/target/debug/deps/libazul_css-4ffeb28145c985cd.rmeta --extern azul_css_parser=/home/felix/Development/azul/target/debug/deps/libazul_css_parser-b54b1c41bd4e1d4b.rmeta --extern gleam=/home/felix/Development/azul/target/debug/deps/libgleam-b31425c365d33d8c.rmeta` Fresh clipboard2 v0.1.1 Fresh wayland-client v0.23.6 Fresh image v0.21.3 Fresh peek-poke v0.2.0 Fresh wr_malloc_size_of v0.1.0 Fresh plane-split v0.15.0 Fresh wayland-protocols v0.23.6 Fresh azul-webrender-api v0.61.0 Fresh smithay-client-toolkit v0.6.6 Fresh azul-webrender v0.61.0 Fresh winit v0.22.2 Fresh glutin v0.24.0 error: internal compiler error: src/librustc/dep_graph/graph.rs:686: DepNode Hir(azul_core[9673]::display_list[0]::displaylist_handle_rect[0]::{{misc}}[2]::{{misc}}[0]) should have been pre-marked as red or green but wasn't. thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:875:9 note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports note: rustc 1.43.1 (8d69840ab 2020-05-04) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type rlib --crate-type cdylib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: aborting due to previous error error: could not compile `azul-core`. Caused by: process didn't exit successfully: `rustc --crate-name azul_core --edition=2018 azul-core/src/lib.rs --error-format=json --json=diagnostic-rendered-ansi --crate-type rlib --crate-type cdylib --emit=dep-info,metadata -C debuginfo=2 --cfg 'feature="azul-css-parser"' --cfg 'feature="css_parser"' --cfg 'feature="default"' --cfg 'feature="gleam"' --cfg 'feature="opengl"' -C metadata=54992c066eb0e957 -C extra-filename=-54992c066eb0e957 --out-dir /home/felix/Development/azul/target/debug/deps -C incremental=/home/felix/Development/azul/target/debug/incremental -L dependency=/home/felix/Development/azul/target/debug/deps --extern azul_css=/home/felix/Development/azul/target/debug/deps/libazul_css-4ffeb28145c985cd.rmeta --extern azul_css_parser=/home/felix/Development/azul/target/debug/deps/libazul_css_parser-b54b1c41bd4e1d4b.rmeta --extern gleam=/home/felix/Development/azul/target/debug/deps/libgleam-b31425c365d33d8c.rmeta` (exit code: 101) ```
Backtrace

# Notes I have no idea why this happens, but it's slightly urgent since I can't compile my code anymore. You can look at the last few commits, they didn't even touch the `DisplayList` code. rustc seems to panic somewhere around here (?): https://github.com/maps4print/azul/blob/d6139f0624528c866374b2dc5a41560b35555792/azul-core/src/display_list.rs#L1107-L1110 I'll test again with another rustc version, but I hope I can keep using the stable branch.
